Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a fish in a water environment like a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can label several plants and animals that live in the water with the fish.
The student can show and label parts of the environment that the fish and other animals need, like water and plants.
The student can use labels to show how fish and other animals depend on water to survive.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently show and label all parts of the system correctly (occasionally forgets a key element like oxygen for fish).
The student might only partially illustrate and label how humans use natural resources like water (could miss detailing how people obtain or use water).
